page.title: 04Oil Exploration
page.content: In April 1985 Dorset County Concil had to consider an application from B.P. to sink 4 test wells on Furzey Island. Furzey Island is on the Wytch Farm Field discovered in 1973. This is the largest onshore oil field in Britain much of which lies under the Dorset mainland but part of which stretches out into Poole Harbour. B.P. stated that Furzey is the most suitable site for appraisal of the northern part of the oil resevoir and it could account for 5-20 million barrels of oil. They claim that there will be no significant impact visually or environmentally. Local objections were raised considering the risk of disastrous oil pollution should a "blow out" occur. The National Trust expressed a lack of satisfaction at the testing of consequences and were unconvinced that there would be no
